itemDescription: British author, scientific illustrator, botanist and botanical collector (1832-1890)

wikipedia_page.main: Frances Elizabeth Tripp (1 August 1832 – 26 December 1890) was a British bryologist, botanical illustrator, philanthropist and writer. She is best known for her two volume work British Mosses, their homes, aspects, structures and uses, which was first published in 1868 and ran to three editions.
